website_summaries.verdict: The bare-bones Wii Mini gets rid of many Wii features to just focus on playing disc games, but the stripped-down experience isn't worth the savings.
pros: The Wii Mini is compact and very affordable, and the bundle's price is only a few dollars more than some of its components would cost if purchased separately
cons: No online functionality means you won't be able to play downloadable retro Wii games or watch Netflix
it can't connect to HDMI ports, and can't display HD video
original Wii can be found for just a bit more, or even less if purchased used

customer_reviews.title: Wii Mini is perfect for seniors!
customer_reviews.text: our first Wii, although we have played with them at other homes. We are a retired couple. We found it VERY easy to set up, and started playing with it immediately. Only suggestion for others here is be sure to follow the set up instructions slowly and carefully. We may end up buying a second controller, although it is not that inconvenient to share the one that came with the bundle. We do not care that the Wii Mini does not have internet capability, as we only intend to use it to play games at home ourselves. Something else to get us up and out of our chairs and moving. We find it lots of fun!
